name: theme-color Meta Tag
description: Meta tag to define a suggested color that browsers should use to customize the display of the page or of the surrounding user interface. The meta tag overrides any theme-color set in the web app manifest.

notes.general: Vivaldi browser (Chromium based) supports this feature in both mobile and desktop version. Also supported in the (now discontinued) Firefox OS.

byNum.1: Desktop Chrome only uses the color on installed `progressive web apps`.
byNum.2: Desktop Chrome 39-72 claimed to have support, but did not actually use the color anywhere. Chrome for Android did use the color in the toolbar.
byNum.3: Chrome for Android does not use the color on devices with native `dark-mode` enabled unless it's an installed `progressive web app` or a `trusted web activity`.
byNum.4: Supported, but does not actually use the color anywhere.
byNum.5: Only supported for installed web apps.
